TransverseMercatorTest.cpp

00001 /**
00002  * \file TransverseMercatorTest.cpp
00003  * \brief Command line utility for testing transverse Mercator projections
00004  *
00005  * Copyright (c) Charles Karney (2008, 2009, 2010) <charles@karney.com>
00006  * and licensed under the LGPL.  For more information, see
00007  * http://geographiclib.sourceforge.net/
00008  *
00009  * Compile with -I../include and link with TransverseMercatorExact.o
00010  * EllipticFunction.o TransverseMercator.o
00011  *
00012  * See \ref transversemercatortest for usage information.
00013  **********************************************************************/
00014 
00015 #include "GeographicLib/EllipticFunction.hpp"
00016 #include "GeographicLib/TransverseMercatorExact.hpp"
00017 #include "GeographicLib/TransverseMercator.hpp"
00018 #include <iostream>
00019 #include <sstream>
00020 #include <iomanip>
00021 
00022 int usage(int retval) {
00023   ( retval ? std::cerr : std::cout ) <<
00024 "TransverseMercatorTest [-r] [-t|-s]\n\
00025 $Id: TransverseMercatorTest.cpp 6785 2010-01-05 22:15:42Z karney $\n\
00026 \n\
00027 Convert between geographic coordinates and transverse Mercator coordinates.\n\
00028 \n\
00029 Read lines with latitude and longitude (or easting and northing if -r is\n\
00030 specified) from standard input and print latitude, longitude, easting,\n\
00031 northing, convergence, and scale.  Units are degrees and meters.\n\
00032 \n\
00033 By default, the WGS84 is ellipsoid is used, central meridian = 0, UTM\n\
00034 central scale (0.9996), and false easting and false northing are zero.\n\
00035 \n\
00036 If -r is given, the reverse projection is performed (the inputs are easting\n\
00037 and northing).\n\
00038 \n\
00039 If -s is given, the sixth-order Krueger series approximation to the\n\
00040 transverse Mercator projection is used instead of the exact projection.\n\
00041 \n\
00042 If -t is specified, an ellipsoid of eccentricity 0.1 is used, central scale\n\
00043 = 1, 1/4 meridian distance = 1.  In addition, the cut in the exact\n\
00044 transverse Mercator projection at northing = 0 is removed.  The domain of\n\
00045 latitude (lat) and longitude (lon) is the union of\n\
00046     lat in [0, 90]  and lon in [0, 90]\n\
00047     lat in (-90, 0] and lon in [81, 90]\n\
00048 The domain of easting (x) and northing (x) is the union of\n\
00049     x in [0, inf)       and y in [0, 1]\n\
00050     x in [1.71..., inf) and y in (-inf, 0]\n\
00051 \n\
00052 -s and -t are mutually exclusive (the last flag specified is the operative\n\
00053 one).\n\
00054 \n\
00055 -h prints this help.\n";
00056   return retval;
00057 }
00058 
00059 int main(int argc, char* argv[]) {
00060   using namespace GeographicLib;
00061   typedef Math::real real;
00062   bool reverse = false, testing = false, series = false;
00063   for (int m = 1; m < argc; ++m) {
00064     std::string arg(argv[m]);
00065     if (arg == "-r")
00066       reverse = true;
00067     else if (arg == "-t") {
00068       testing = true;
00069       series = false;
00070     } else if (arg == "-s") {
00071       testing = false;
00072       series = true;
00073     } else
00074       return usage(arg != "-h");
00075   }
00076 
00077   real e, a;
00078   if (testing) {
00079     e = real(0.1L);
00080     GeographicLib::EllipticFunction temp(e * e);
00081     a = 1/temp.E();
00082   }
00083   const GeographicLib::TransverseMercatorExact& TME = testing ?
00084     GeographicLib::TransverseMercatorExact
00085     (a, (std::sqrt(1 - e * e) + 1) / (e * e), real(1), true) :
00086     GeographicLib::TransverseMercatorExact::UTM;
00087 
00088   const GeographicLib::TransverseMercator& TMS =
00089     GeographicLib::TransverseMercator::UTM;
00090 
00091   std::string s;
00092   int retval = 0;
00093   std::cout << std::setprecision(16);
00094   while (std::getline(std::cin, s)) {
00095     try {
00096       std::istringstream str(s);
00097       real lat, lon, x, y;
00098       if (!(reverse ?
00099             (str >> x >> y) :
00100             (str >> lat >> lon)))
00101         throw  GeographicErr("Incomplete input: " + s);
00102       std::string strc;
00103       if (str >> strc)
00104         throw GeographicErr("Extraneous input: " + strc);
00105       real gamma, k;
00106       if (reverse) {
00107         if (series)
00108           TMS.Reverse(real(0), x, y, lat, lon, gamma, k);
00109         else
00110           TME.Reverse(real(0), x, y, lat, lon, gamma, k);
00111       } else {
00112         if (series)
00113           TMS.Forward(real(0), lat, lon, x, y, gamma, k);
00114         else
00115           TME.Forward(real(0), lat, lon, x, y, gamma, k);
00116       }
00117       std::cout << lat << " " << lon << " " << x << " " << y << " "
00118                 << gamma << " " << k << "\n";
00119     }
00120     catch (const std::exception& e) {
00121       std::cout << "ERROR: " << e.what() << "\n";
00122       retval = 1;
00123     }
00124   }
00125 
00126   return retval;
00127 }
